nodes.documentation:
@dev Set how many seconds any request can stay active from its creation onward
@param _secondAmount - Number of seconds*
nodes.name: changeMaxRequestAvailability

nodes.documentation:
@dev How many credit points an address can borrow at any time
@param points - The max number of credit points an address can borrow at any point in time*
nodes.name: changeMaxBorrowedPoints

nodes.documentation:
@dev Get your credit score. The first array gives the categories, the second
one gives the level where the caller is at for each category.
For example, if we determine off-chain that the user has the following:
Deposit history: 6 - 10 weeks
Investing history length: Below 6 months - 10 points
Bank spam: 0
Mortgages seeked in the last 6 months: 2 - 5
Outstanding debt: 501 - 10K MANA
Times defaulted: 0 times
then the user would need to pass the arrays:
["DEPOSIT HISTORY", "INVESTING HISTORY LENGTH", "BANK SPAM", "MORTGAGES SEEKED IN THE LAST 6 MONTHS", "OUTSTANDING DEBT", "TIMES DEFAULTED"]
[2, 1, 0, 1, 2, 0]
The function (for now) simply returns the sum of the points
mapped to each level from each category minus points lent plus points borrowed. In this case,
30 + 10 + 30 + 30 + 20 + 70 = 190 (credit points)
@param _user - The _user for which the score is being computed
@param categories - The array of categories taken into account
@param elements - The array of levels for each category as explained above*
nodes.name: computeCreditScore
computeAndUpdateScore
registerUser
requestCreditPoints
fillRequest

nodes.documentation:
@dev Cancel a request. Only the creator can cancel. Also the creator cannot
cancel if a request has already been filled. Finally, the creator needs
to wait minCancelRequestDelay seconds since the creation of the request
in order to cancel it*
nodes.name: cancelRequest
changeRequestCoinOffered
changeRequestCoinAmountOffered
payBackDebt
borrowerGetBackCollateral
punishBorrowerNonPayment
setCardOption
toggleWhitelistedCoin

Times defaulted: 0 times
then the user would need to pass the arrays:
["DEPOSIT HISTORY", "INVESTING HISTORY LENGTH", "BANK SPAM", "MORTGAGES SEEKED IN THE LAST 6 MONTHS", "OUTSTANDING DEBT", "TIMES DEFAULTED"]
[2, 1, 0, 1, 2, 0]
The function (for now) simply returns the sum of the points
mapped to each level from each category minus points lent plus points borrowed. In this case,

@param _user - The _user for which the score is being computed

nodes.documentation:
@dev Cancel a request. Only the creator can cancel. Also the creator cannot
cancel if a request has already been filled. Finally, the creator needs
to wait minCancelRequestDelay seconds since the creation of the request
in order to cancel it*
nodes.name: cancelRequest
changeRequestCoinOffered
changeRequestCoinAmountOffered
payBackDebt
borrowerGetBackCollateral
punishBorrowerNonPayment

borrowerGetBackCollateral(uint256).details: The borrower can get back their collateral only if: They paid all the necessary ERC20 tokens to the lender They waited at least WAIT_FOR_COLLATERAL_RETREIVAL seconds after the request reached maturity

params.position: - The position of the request in creditRequests*

cancelRequest(uint256).details: Cancel a request. Only the creator can cancel. Also the creator cannot cancel if a request has already been filled. Finally, the creator needs to wait minCancelRequestDelay seconds since the creation of the request in order to cancel it*

changeMaxBorrowedPoints(uint256).details: How many credit points an address can borrow at any time

params.points: - The max number of credit points an address can borrow at any point in time*

changeMaxRequestAvailability(uint256).details: Set how many seconds any request can stay active from its creation onward

changeRequestCoinAmountOffered(uint256,u.details: Change how many ERC20 coins the borrower offers for credit points

params.coinAmount: - New ERC20 amount to be paid toward the lender*
params.position: - The position of the request in creditRequests

changeRequestCoinOffered(uint256,address.details: Change the address of the token offered to the lender in exchange for their credit points

params.newCoinOffered: - The address of the new ERC20 offered; the ERC20 needs to be whitelisted*
params.position: - The position of the request in creditRequests

computeAndUpdateScore(address,string[],u.details: This function does the same thing as computeCreditScore but with an addition. It stores the score in the personalScore field inside the user's struct. Note that only the owner can call this because a user can put random numbers in the elements array and artificially boost their score. As a proof to show that they chose the correct params in the elements array, the owner needs to specify an IPFS address where the credit data for an address is stored and acts as proof.

params.elements: - The array of levels for each category as explained in computeCreditScore
params.ipfsCreditDataProof: - IPFS hash pointing to credit data that serves as proof ipfsCreditDataProof needs to be emitted in an event*
params.user: - The address of the user we compute for

computeCreditScore(address,string[],uint.details: Get your credit score. The first array gives the categories, the second one gives the level where the caller is at for each category. For example, if we determine off-chain that the user has the following: Deposit history: 6 - 10 weeks Investing history length: Below 6 months - 10 points Bank spam: 0 Mortgages seeked in the last 6 months: 2 - 5 Outstanding debt: 501 - 10K MANA Times defaulted: 0 times then the user would need to pass the arrays: ["DEPOSIT HISTORY", "INVESTING HISTORY LENGTH", "BANK SPAM", "MORTGAGES SEEKED IN THE LAST 6 MONTHS", "OUTSTANDING DEBT", "TIMES DEFAULTED"] [2, 1, 0, 1, 2, 0] The function (for now) simply returns the sum of the points mapped to each level from each category minus points lent plus points borrowed. In this case, 30 + 10 + 30 + 30 + 20 + 70 = 190 (credit points)

params._user: - The _user for which the score is being computed
params.categories: - The array of categories taken into account
params.elements: - The array of levels for each category as explained above*

fillRequest(uint256).details: Fill a credit points request. We need to check that the lender is currently lending at max MAX_LENT_CREDIT_POINTS and they are not going above the limit by also lending for this request. The number of points being asked for in the request will be decreased from the lender's personalScore and increased in their currentlyLentPoints

params.position: - The position of the request in creditRequests*

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

payBackDebt(uint256,uint256).details: Pay ERC20 tokens to fulfill a request filled by a lender for you. The caller needs to approve this contract to transfer the correct ERC20 token to the lender. Also the caller does not necessarily need to be the borrower. The caller can pay at max how many tokens were specified in the request. The caller does not need to pay everything at once.

params._coinAmount: - How many ERC20 tokens are being sent to the lender*
params.position: - The position of the request in

punishBorrowerNonPayment(uint256).details: The lender can confiscate the borrower's collateral in case they didn't pay all the ERC20 tokens until the request reached maturity

params.position: - The position of the request in creditRequests*

registerUser(address).details: A user can register themselves in the CreditScoring contract. Registration is needed to initialize the user's struct where we store their data.

params._user: - If the owner is calling this function, they can register a user without the user paying gas fees*

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

requestCreditPoints(address,uint256,uint.details: Request credit points. Alternatively the owner can request points on behalf of a user

params._lendingDuration: - How many seconds this address wants to keep the borrowed points
params.coinAmountOffered: - The amount of ERC20 coins offered*
params.coinOffered: - The ERC20 coin offered as interest payment
params.pointsToBorrow: - How many points _user wants to borrow

setCardOption(string,uint256,int256).details: Set points for a certain criteria and a level as outlined here:     http://tiny.cc/oeba5y

params.elementName: - A string denoting the criteria. Ex: "Deposit history", "Investing history length"
params.elementOption: - The level for a criteria. Ex: for Deposit history there are 5 different levels, so we can make elementOption any number between 0 - 4
params.score: - The points given for the level on this criteria*

toggleWhitelistedCoin(address).details: Whitelist a coin to be used as collateral or as payment for lending credit points. If a coin is already set to true, it will be set to false and vice-versa

params.coin: - The address of the token contract we toggle*

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.
